recipes.name: Traditional Ragi Porridge
recipes.description: A nutritious and warming breakfast porridge made with ragi flour, perfect for starting your day with sustained energy.
instructions: Mix ragi flour with 1/2 cup water to make a smooth paste without lumps
Heat remaining water in a pan and bring to boil
Slowly add the ragi paste while stirring continuously
Cook on medium heat for 5-7 minutes, stirring constantly
Add milk and jaggery, mix well
Add cardamom powder and cook for another 2-3 minutes
Garnish with ghee and chopped nuts before serving
tips: Can be made with water only for dairy-free version

recipes.name: Jowar Roti
recipes.description: Traditional flatbread made with jowar flour, perfect for a healthy and gluten-free meal accompaniment.
instructions: Mix jowar flour and salt in a large bowl
Gradually add warm water and knead into a soft dough
Divide dough into 8 equal portions
Roll each portion into a circle using rolling pin
Heat a tawa and cook each roti until golden spots appear
Flip and cook the other side, apply ghee if desired
Serve hot with curry or vegetables
tips: Use warm water for better binding
Roll between plastic sheets to prevent sticking

recipes.name: Bajra Khichdi
recipes.description: Comforting one-pot meal made with pearl millet, lentils, and vegetables. Perfect for cold winter evenings.
instructions: Soak bajra in water for 2 hours, then drain
Heat ghee in pressure cooker, add cumin seeds
Add chopped onion and sauté until golden
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute
Add vegetables, turmeric, and salt
Add soaked bajra and moong dal
Add water and pressure cook for 4-5 whistles
Serve hot with ghee on top
tips: Add more ghee for richer taste

recipes.name: Foxtail Millet Upma
recipes.description: Healthy and delicious South Indian breakfast dish made with foxtail millet instead of semolina.
instructions: Wash foxtail millet and soak for 30 minutes
Heat oil in pan, add mustard seeds and urad dal
Add curry leaves, green chilies, and onion
Sauté until onion turns translucent
Add mixed vegetables and cook for 3-4 minutes
Add drained millet and sauté for 2 minutes
Add water and salt, bring to boil
Cover and cook on low heat for 15 minutes
Fluff with fork and serve hot
tips: Can add peanuts for extra crunch

recipes.name: Mixed Millet Laddu
recipes.description: Nutritious and delicious sweet balls made with a combination of different millet flours and jaggery.
instructions: Heat a pan and dry roast each flour separately until aromatic
Roast nuts and sesame seeds separately
Melt jaggery with little water to make syrup
Heat ghee in another pan
Mix all roasted flours, nuts, and cardamom
Add hot ghee and jaggery syrup to the mixture
Mix well and shape into laddus while warm
Let them cool and store in airtight container
tips: Shape laddus while mixture is warm
Can use honey instead of jaggery
Store in cool place for longer shelf life

recipes.name: Millet Power Salad
recipes.description: Refreshing and nutritious salad made with cooked millets, fresh vegetables, and a light dressing.
instructions: Cook foxtail millet and let it cool completely
Chop all vegetables into small pieces
In a large bowl, mix cooked millet and vegetables
Add chopped mint leaves
Whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper
Pour dressing over salad and mix gently
Refrigerate for 30 minutes before serving
Serve chilled as a complete meal
tips: Add protein like chickpeas or tofu

recipes.name: Mixed Millet Dosa
recipes.description: Crispy and healthy dosa made with a blend of different millet flours and urad dal.
instructions: Wash and soak all millets and urad dal separately for 4 hours
Soak fenugreek seeds with urad dal
Grind urad dal to smooth paste
Grind millets to fine paste separately
Mix both batters, add salt, and ferment overnight
Heat dosa pan and pour ladle of batter
Spread thin and cook until crispy
Serve hot with chutney and sambar
tips: Can add rice for softer texture

recipes.name: Millet Banana Pancakes
recipes.description: Healthy and delicious pancakes made with millet flour and ripe bananas, perfect for breakfast or snack.
instructions: Mash bananas in a large bowl
Add egg and milk, whisk well
In another bowl, mix ragi flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt
Combine wet and dry ingredients gently
Heat pan and add butter
Pour small portions of batter
Cook until bubbles form, then flip
Serve warm with honey drizzle
tips: Can make eggless with flax eggs

recipes.name: Millet Smoothie Bowl
recipes.description: Nutritious and Instagram-worthy smoothie bowl topped with cooked millets, fresh fruits, and nuts.
instructions: Cook barnyard millet and let it cool
Blend frozen banana, mango, and coconut milk until smooth
Pour smoothie into bowls
Top with cooked millet, fresh berries, and granola
Sprinkle chia seeds and coconut flakes
Arrange toppings artfully
Serve immediately while cold
tips: Use frozen fruits for thick consistency
